intro: Brachystelma glabriflorum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered stone orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its compact, often rock-dwelling growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are usually succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Brachystelma glabriflorum is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
